subject: Add conditional around the pid clean up process
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 10:51:36.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': "Add conditional around the pid clean up process

The NS metadata proxy pid cleanup process hunts for and removes
PIDs executing old code by using version tags. Under certain
conditions it's possible for an old PID to have expired before
the cleanup action has run. This change simply wraps the
`pkill` command with a test to ensure the task isn't failing.
Should a PID actually be cleaned up the task will print to stdout
and log using the logger command.

Closes-Bug: #1627185
Change-Id: I8c012feb399f8ca65172e9404b859c8f6111de35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cfb341a368b277d43b30da2e3b9a3431e1ad9c9a)
"}]
commit_message:
Add conditional around the pid clean up process

The NS metadata proxy pid cleanup process hunts for and removes
PIDs executing old code by using version tags. Under certain
conditions it's possible for an old PID to have expired before
the cleanup action has run. This change simply wraps the
`pkill` command with a test to ensure the task isn't failing.
Should a PID actually be cleaned up the task will print to stdout
and log using the logger command.

Closes-Bug: #1627185
Change-Id: I8c012feb399f8ca65172e9404b859c8f6111de35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cfb341a368b277d43b30da2e3b9a3431e1ad9c9a)

subject: Fix race condition on installing Packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 13:07:47.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_client_install.yml'], 'message': 'Fix race condition on installing Packages

We're seeing intermittent issues when installing the galera_client
packages. The pip package install happens before the apt/yum package
install in some situations, which is causing failures to
nova/neutron/ironic/tempest gates.

This PR removes the "static: no" statement around the apt and yum
install tasks to ensure the ordering is consistent.

Change-Id: I92e317a0303f7b358b029948014053918ad50888
Partial-Bug: #1628851
(cherry picked from commit 72d72c86bd31a7570a1cb24b399aadee53180b92)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition on installing Packages

We're seeing intermittent issues when installing the galera_client
packages. The pip package install happens before the apt/yum package
install in some situations, which is causing failures to
nova/neutron/ironic/tempest gates.

This PR removes the "static: no" statement around the apt and yum
install tasks to ensure the ordering is consistent.

Change-Id: I92e317a0303f7b358b029948014053918ad50888
Partial-Bug: #1628851
(cherry picked from commit 72d72c86bd31a7570a1cb24b399aadee53180b92)

subject: Fix simulator bool command line args
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 09:46:04.000000000', 'files': ['tools/simulator.py'], 'message': "Fix simulator bool command line args

--debug, --is-cast and --is-fanout are defined as args of type=bool.
This means that, for example, if we want to enable debug logging
level, we have to type '--debug True'. But we can also use
'--debug False' in order to do the same, which is very misleading
(in fact, any non-empty string will evaluate to True). This patch
tries to solve this problem by replacing type=bool and
default=False with action='store_true' for these args, so that
we will be able to enable them (they will remain False by default
as before) simply as '--debug' etc.

Change-Id: I8ee04c35427df446966161491da8d264b44975bf
"}]
commit_message:
Fix simulator bool command line args

--debug, --is-cast and --is-fanout are defined as args of type=bool.
This means that, for example, if we want to enable debug logging
level, we have to type '--debug True'. But we can also use
'--debug False' in order to do the same, which is very misleading
(in fact, any non-empty string will evaluate to True). This patch
tries to solve this problem by replacing type=bool and
default=False with action='store_true' for these args, so that
we will be able to enable them (they will remain False by default
as before) simply as '--debug' etc.

Change-Id: I8ee04c35427df446966161491da8d264b44975bf

This creates new resource type whose intended use case is for
admin-only use and specifically to manage the Compute service
quota. This would be an enhancement to avoid manual, post-
deployment modifications of the project's (and user's) Compute
service quota. This will enable the admin to fully orchestrate
the project by using heat without the need to make manual
updates afterwards.

Change-Id: I78cb376d60a826d21c3bad9657bda11dcc51c3f1
"}]
commit_message:
New Resource Type OS::Nova::Quota

This creates new resource type whose intended use case is for
admin-only use and specifically to manage the Compute service
quota. This would be an enhancement to avoid manual, post-
deployment modifications of the project's (and user's) Compute
service quota. This will enable the admin to fully orchestrate
the project by using heat without the need to make manual
updates afterwards.

Change-Id: I78cb376d60a826d21c3bad9657bda11dcc51c3f1

commit_message:
Set fixed_network_name in our devstack plugin

[0] fixed how this was set, as it wasn't intended to be set when using
Neutron. However, our testing relies on it being there, so use our
plugin to put it back while we find a way to get away from it.

subject: Fix race condition on installing Packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 10:53:02.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_client_install.yml'], 'message': 'Fix race condition on installing Packages

We're seeing intermittent issues when installing the galera_client
packages. The pip package install happens before the apt/yum package
install in some situations, which is causing failures to
nova/neutron/ironic/tempest gates.

This PR removes the "static: no" statement around the apt and yum
install tasks to ensure the ordering is consistent.

Change-Id: I92e317a0303f7b358b029948014053918ad50888
Partial-Bug: #1628851
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition on installing Packages

We're seeing intermittent issues when installing the galera_client
packages. The pip package install happens before the apt/yum package
install in some situations, which is causing failures to
nova/neutron/ironic/tempest gates.

This PR removes the "static: no" statement around the apt and yum
install tasks to ensure the ordering is consistent.

Change-Id: I92e317a0303f7b358b029948014053918ad50888
Partial-Bug: #1628851

[{'number': 39, 'created': '2016-09-28 20:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/objects/db/test_api.py', 'neutron/objects/common_types.py', 'neutron/objects/port/extensions/extra_dhcp_opt.py', 'neutron/objects/network/network_segment.py', 'neutron/objects/db/api.py', 'neutron/objects/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/qos/test_policy.py', 'neutron/objects/extensions/port_security.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_common_types.py', 'neutron/objects/ports.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/models.py', 'neutron/objects/port/extensions/allowedaddresspairs.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_ports.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'neutron/db/models_v2.py'], 'message': "Introduce ovo objects for ports

Those objects are intentionally not integrated into the database code so
far. This is to quicken access to their definitions to implement
push-notifications for security groups and ports.

The object embeds segmentation information in addition to what's
available through the model. Specifically, binding_levels field exposes

is achieved through a 'segment' ObjectField. The database model itself
contains segment_id too. There is no reason though to expose it for
Level object in two places (one as a model field, another one through
the ObjectField), so we avoid adding ID field. The base class that
handles loading for ObjectField based synthetic fields was assuming that
objects always have a field per model attribute, so it needed a slight
adjustment to support this case, where we extract foreign_keys
attributes from the model itself if the field is not present on the
object.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

Change-Id: I25de14e42e345d9235dbf4097c298ef5d606de51

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>

commit_message:
Introduce ovo objects for ports

Those objects are intentionally not integrated into the database code so
far. This is to quicken access to their definitions to implement
push-notifications for security groups and ports.

The object embeds segmentation information in addition to what's
available through the model. Specifically, binding_levels field exposes
all ml2 binding levels, that from their side load corresponding network
segment object. The order for level objects in binding_levels list field
is guaranteed to be in the order of level. So the consumers can eg.
access the bottom binding info with:

  port_obj.binding_levels[-1].segment

For PortBindingLevel object, we want to expose segmentation info. This
is achieved through a 'segment' ObjectField. The database model itself
contains segment_id too. There is no reason though to expose it for
Level object in two places (one as a model field, another one through
the ObjectField), so we avoid adding ID field. The base class that
handles loading for ObjectField based synthetic fields was assuming that
objects always have a field per model attribute, so it needed a slight
adjustment to support this case, where we extract foreign_keys
attributes from the model itself if the field is not present on the
object.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

Change-Id: I25de14e42e345d9235dbf4097c298ef5d606de51
Co-Authored-By: Martin Hickey <martin.hickey@ie.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rossella Sblendido <rsblendido@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>

This change will let the driver locate the instance files in this
situation.

Closes-Bug: #1621334

commit_message:
Properly handle instances when not placed at configured location

In some situations, we may have to handle instances that are located
at a different path than the configured one. For example, this can
happen in case of failed over instances when multiple CSVs are used
among hosts.

This change will let the driver locate the instance files in this
situation.

Depends-On: I56c1394fdd3e93598e1b41d354c072ae06264201
Depends-On: Ia7623a689854f937d70323cf38818d7534f3ccd9

(cherry picked from commit 6975149ada1cff5dcb36879096b68a3f7e71204f)

Change-Id: Ibf78880413dbed6acdb0bca76010893621e944e2
Closes-Bug: #1621334

commit_message:
Add option to specify Certmonger CA

This will be used for internal (or even public) TLS, for when
certmonger is generating the certificates. This same setting is used
for the undercloud with the generate_service_certificate option.

Change-Id: Ic54fe512b9ed5c71417a66491b7954e653f660b6

commit_message:
Replace local_vlan_map with vlan manager

With the patch mentioned in Depends-On, OVS agent drops using
local_vlan_map and uses vlan manager instead. This patch accommodates
that.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-08 11:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone.conf.j2', 'tasks/main.yml', 'templates/keystone-credential-rotate.sh.j2', 'tasks/keystone_credential_create.yml', 'tasks/keystone_credential.yml', 'tasks/keystone_credential_distribute.yml', 'tests/test-keystone-functional.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/keystone_credential_autorotate.yml'], 'message': "Add credential_setup for keystone

We need to setup the appropriate directory for credential_setup and run
the keystone-manage credential_setup command.

We created the directory and the '[credential]' stanza in the
keystone.conf, which will ensure we can add additional settings using
config_template if any further are required.

We need to setup the autorotation cron job and distribution for
credential keys.

Additionally, we include all tempest tests now that we are
supporting this feature.

Change-Id: Ifd85ed1a64538ed037e4426cc50238d2b16d51e5
"}]
commit_message:
Add credential_setup for keystone

We need to setup the appropriate directory for credential_setup and run
the keystone-manage credential_setup command.

We created the directory and the '[credential]' stanza in the
keystone.conf, which will ensure we can add additional settings using
config_template if any further are required.

We need to setup the autorotation cron job and distribution for
credential keys.

Additionally, we include all tempest tests now that we are
supporting this feature.

Change-Id: Ifd85ed1a64538ed037e4426cc50238d2b16d51e5

commit_message:
api-docs: deprecate the Images v1 API

This patch updates the "narrative" Images v1 API docs for the
Newton release by adding a deprecation note to each page.  That
way the note will be seen even if someone uses a direct link to
one of the pages.

The Images v1 API was deprecated with commit
63e6dbb1eb006758fbcf7cae83e1d2eacf46b4ab.

Change-Id: I62315efc12ee05aea5f55d020006cbb2ad279876
Partial-bug: #1618495

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 10:53:01.000000000', 'files': ['templates/ironic.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Turn on debug output from IPA by default

There's no real cost to having IPA debug output on, and it helps
operators work out from a KVM what went wrong when things get
exciting. So let's just turn it on by default.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Carden <mike.carden@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2ac525570088ea4494968666213d6f583bd5ede9
(cherry picked from commit 378727f47abe5bdbbb22eab0969ad67c7b9cb090)
"}]
commit_message:
Turn on debug output from IPA by default

There's no real cost to having IPA debug output on, and it helps
operators work out from a KVM what went wrong when things get
exciting. So let's just turn it on by default.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Carden <mike.carden@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2ac525570088ea4494968666213d6f583bd5ede9
(cherry picked from commit 378727f47abe5bdbbb22eab0969ad67c7b9cb090)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 10:53:17.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Update ironic auth options for Keystone v3 auth

The auth parameters `admin_username`, `admin_password`,
`admin_tenant_name` and `admin_url` of the [ironic] config
option group are now deprecated and will be removed in a
future release. Using these parameters will log a warning.
Please use `username`, `password`, `project_name `and
`auth_url` instead.
Update ironic auth options for Keystone v3  API support.
The link[1] can explain.
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/conf/ironic.py#n38

Change-Id: I33f3cb1b52a8c69b7a2711b47662b02967a74265
(cherry picked from commit 81aee820b5a5c1ee2fbba0c78005fa67c699a23f)
'}]
commit_message:
Update ironic auth options for Keystone v3 auth

The auth parameters `admin_username`, `admin_password`,
`admin_tenant_name` and `admin_url` of the [ironic] config
option group are now deprecated and will be removed in a
future release. Using these parameters will log a warning.
Please use `username`, `password`, `project_name `and
`auth_url` instead.
Update ironic auth options for Keystone v3  API support.
The link[1] can explain.
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/conf/ironic.py#n38

Change-Id: I33f3cb1b52a8c69b7a2711b47662b02967a74265
(cherry picked from commit 81aee820b5a5c1ee2fbba0c78005fa67c699a23f)

commit_message:
Fixed openstack-auth -> django-openstack-auth

The python-openstack-auth is a transition package to
python-django-openstack-auth. Fixing this build-depends.

Change-Id: I895615dbb872439524d731d31c134a5b60054603

commit_message:
Replace deprecated constants by direct usage

self.d_env.admin_net = 'admin'
'nat_interface' = ''
This patch is reduces warnings amount during
tests run on fuel-devops 3.0.3+

Change-Id: I2bf54952bff79b9483c121a78383e136bcd2a351

commit_message:
Add close-election utility and archive rendering

* close-election [ptl|tc] generate a yaml archive in doc/source
* docs render the results pages based on the archive
* add documentation about the whole election officials process

Change-Id: I8f737f33befc1e8af52dac9c059f73e2874eb5f8

commit_message:
Add gate test for fuelmenu

Add new file: test_review_in_fuel_menu.py
    Scenario:
        1. Revert environment prepare_release
        2. Upload package
        3. Update fuel-menu rpm package from review
        4. Execute 'bootstrap_admin_node.sh' on master
Update doc/base_tests.rst with added test

Change-Id: I70636aed14491ae21e1c2d4dcc968c343bdaea7d
Closes-Bug: #1560995

commit_message:
[WIP] Cleanup lists if apt-get update failed

If apt-get update fails it might left partial files that
might lead to HTTP 416 errors while getting files, but
not failing apt-get update.

This commit adds cleanup before each try.

Change-Id: I36e3b0002c4e50e023138bd3094cb6e8f89c16b2

subject: Stopping the neutron l3 agent before controller upgrade procedure
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-11 15:25:07.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_util_node.py', 'octane/util/node.py', 'octane/magic_consts.py', 'octane/handlers/upgrade/controller.py'], 'message': 'Stopping the neutron l3 agent before controller upgrade procedure

Graceful shutdown of l3 agent with migration of routers
served by it allows to minimize network disruption for
tenant VMs during the upgrade procedure.

Otherwise the abnormal shutdown of l3 agent causes routers
to be unavailable for 10s of minutes upon upgrade of the
first controller from the environment.

Change-Id: I1360bba260ffc4b16565a3d97cfa708bbf6bcdec
Closes-Bug: #1543972
'}]
commit_message:
Stopping the neutron l3 agent before controller upgrade procedure

Graceful shutdown of l3 agent with migration of routers
served by it allows to minimize network disruption for
tenant VMs during the upgrade procedure.

Otherwise the abnormal shutdown of l3 agent causes routers
to be unavailable for 10s of minutes upon upgrade of the
first controller from the environment.

Change-Id: I1360bba260ffc4b16565a3d97cfa708bbf6bcdec
Closes-Bug: #1543972

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-20 17:28:52.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml'], 'message': 'Restrict usage of Radosgw if swift for images is selected

Deployment when we enable Radosgw and have Swift for Glance
is wrong. In this case radosgw works as swift api and stores
glance images in rgw.bucket rbd storage instead of swift storage.

Change-Id: I4586f2253491ff268feff8859fa5f96f730d3570
Partially-Closes-Bug: 1604879
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict usage of Radosgw if swift for images is selected

Deployment when we enable Radosgw and have Swift for Glance
is wrong. In this case radosgw works as swift api and stores
glance images in rgw.bucket rbd storage instead of swift storage.

Change-Id: I4586f2253491ff268feff8859fa5f96f730d3570
Partially-Closes-Bug: 1604879

[WIP] Switch to new kesytone authtoken parameters

Since upstream puppet modules are switching to new
keystone authoken parameters, we need to adapt library
to use it.

commit_message:
Graphs upload and download interface unified

Deployment engineers reported that is hard to use current graphs
CLI interface, so it was re-worked.

Now it is possible to work with graphs following ways:

    $ graph upload --env ENV_ID --file new_graph.yaml [--type GRAPH_TYPE]
    $ graph download --env ENV_ID [--file new_graph.yaml] [--type GRAPH_TYPE]
    $ graph download --env ENV_ID --merged-plugins (download merged plugins graph for env)
    $ graph download --env ENV_ID --merged-all (download completely merged graph for env)

    $ graph upload --plugin PLUGIN_ID --file new_graph.yaml [--type GRAPH_TYPE]
    $ graph download --plugin PLUGIN_ID [--file new_graph.yaml] [--type GRAPH_TYPE]

    $ graph upload --release RELEASE_ID --file new_graph.yaml [--type GRAPH_TYPE]
    $ graph download --release RELEASE_ID [--file new_graph.yaml] [--type GRAPH_TYPE]

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib51b528b05e73520b9dfa2fe341ae202080da79a
Partial-Bug: #1563851

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-01 10:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix problems with os-username and os-password usage

In case, when we import DefaultAPIClient, it tries to instantiate
APIClient.default_client with settings object, but at time of initialization
username and password parameters are not being parsed yet. It causes situation,
that it always instantiates with default credentials.
In order to prevent it, lazy initializer was created. APIClient.default_client
will be executed on first actual usage which is performed after parameters
parsing.
DefaultApiClientClass should be never used directly and will be removed
in the next version.

Closes-Bug: #1593721
Change-Id: Ic0608f11a5db60691f766608fe8eee578c9fb0c6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix problems with os-username and os-password usage

In case, when we import DefaultAPIClient, it tries to instantiate
APIClient.default_client with settings object, but at time of initialization
username and password parameters are not being parsed yet. It causes situation,
that it always instantiates with default credentials.
In order to prevent it, lazy initializer was created. APIClient.default_client
will be executed on first actual usage which is performed after parameters
parsing.
DefaultApiClientClass should be never used directly and will be removed
in the next version.

Closes-Bug: #1593721
Change-Id: Ic0608f11a5db60691f766608fe8eee578c9fb0c6

commit_message:
Update plugin attributes with component-bound values

Currently, the bound values from plugin-defined
components are stored with the rest of the cluster
information. It is being overwritten on each plugin
attributes merge. This patch introduces a mechanism
to store plugin-specific bound values in ClusterPlugin.

Change-Id: Id645877b23a75461a6ed88db6164f19978789e19
Closes-Bug: #1611651

commit_message:
Add environment with venv taken from cli.

This way we can run test on pre-configured environment via:

    $ VENV_PATH=some/venv tox -e custom-venv

Change-Id: Ic4a20cc29272cff8a9164f45f4b48e9207cc780d

Closes-Bug: #1509069

commit_message:
Pull out upstream mysql grant provider

* switch to employ account-management statements to modify
  the grant tables indirectly
* remove redundant "flush privileges" from user provider
  since server notices all the changes and loads the tables
  into memory again immediately

Change-Id: I28dcfd0c932a9e438cd6cf00fdeb5fa19fd0431e
Closes-Bug: #1509069

subject: Test address setting code paths
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 10:39:46.000000000', 'files': ['tests/host_vars/swift-storage4.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'tests/host_vars/swift-storage3.yml', 'tests/host_vars/swift-storage1.yml'], 'message': 'Test address setting code paths

We can set the storage and replication addresses differently for each of
the 3 swift-hosts.

swift-storage1 will use the "swift_storage_address" and
"swift_replication_address" values to set it's service and ring IPs.

swift-storage2 will use the default IPs calculated by finding the IP on
the appropriate interfaces (eth2 for storage and eth3 for replication).

swift-storage3 will use the swift_vars.storage_ip and swift_vars.repl_ip
vars to set it's service and ring IPs

This PR makes the gate more efficient by removing swift-storage4.

Depends-On: Iac72c99fc728fad82da65ae6c68a304e3d130bc1
Change-Id: I8f7eb551072a6cd6ad50c2a99c4dfc6652374efe
(cherry picked from commit bfd73a50cc9df99d1432083a23d3429cb98e4f71)
'}]
commit_message:
Test address setting code paths

We can set the storage and replication addresses differently for each of
the 3 swift-hosts.

swift-storage1 will use the "swift_storage_address" and
"swift_replication_address" values to set it's service and ring IPs.

swift-storage2 will use the default IPs calculated by finding the IP on
the appropriate interfaces (eth2 for storage and eth3 for replication).

swift-storage3 will use the swift_vars.storage_ip and swift_vars.repl_ip
vars to set it's service and ring IPs

This PR makes the gate more efficient by removing swift-storage4.

Depends-On: Iac72c99fc728fad82da65ae6c68a304e3d130bc1
Change-Id: I8f7eb551072a6cd6ad50c2a99c4dfc6652374efe
(cherry picked from commit bfd73a50cc9df99d1432083a23d3429cb98e4f71)

revisions:
[{'number': 37, 'created': '2016-09-29 15:36:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/network.py', 'neutron/db/portsecurity_db_common.py', 'neutron/objects/network/network_segment.py', 'neutron/db/segments_db.py', 'neutron/objects/network/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/qos/test_policy.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/network/extensions/__init__.py', 'neutron/objects/network/extensions/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/network/extensions/test_port_security.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_network.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'neutron/tests/tools.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_ports.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/network/test_network_segment.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_portsecurity_db_common.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/network/__init__.py', 'neutron/objects/network/extensions/port_security.py'], 'message': 'Introduce ovo objects for networks

Those objects are intentionally not integrated into the database code so
far. This is to quicken access to their definitions to implement
push-notifications for networks.

Segments are part of the network object. Since we need to reduce the
number of SQL queries executed per resource, and we want to include
segmentation information for networks, Network model was extended with
segments relationship that makes the information available on every
network resource fetch from the database. This change required some
change in test_dhcp_agent_scheduler to expire a session used in the
tests to avoid obsolete segment state to be reused to validate
scheduling.

This implementation of the object is not complete for the job of
updating the resource in database. For example, tags are not yet exposed
on the object; also attributes like availability_zones, or external
network attributes, are not covered. Those attributes are hopefully
needed on server side only, so until we adopt the object for server
side, it should be ok to live without them.

Another database related thing still missing in this patch is lack of
RBAC support for the object. To complete this support,
a real get_bound_tenant_ids should be put onto the object, instead of
the current no-op stub.

This patch also includes some rearrangements that simplified the work.
Specifically, all network related objects are consolidated in the
neutron.objects.network module, instead of being scattered through the
code base. Also, some setup code from test_policy relevant to RBAC was
moved into the base test class so that it can be utilized by other RBAC
enabled objects, like network.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5160d0ab9e8042c356229420739db0ce42842368
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce ovo objects for networks

Those objects are intentionally not integrated into the database code so
far. This is to quicken access to their definitions to implement
push-notifications for networks.

Segments are part of the network object. Since we need to reduce the
number of SQL queries executed per resource, and we want to include
segmentation information for networks, Network model was extended with
segments relationship that makes the information available on every
network resource fetch from the database. This change required some
change in test_dhcp_agent_scheduler to expire a session used in the
tests to avoid obsolete segment state to be reused to validate
scheduling.

This implementation of the object is not complete for the job of
updating the resource in database. For example, tags are not yet exposed
on the object; also attributes like availability_zones, or external
network attributes, are not covered. Those attributes are hopefully
needed on server side only, so until we adopt the object for server
side, it should be ok to live without them.

Another database related thing still missing in this patch is lack of
RBAC support for the object. To complete this support,
a real get_bound_tenant_ids should be put onto the object, instead of
the current no-op stub.

This patch also includes some rearrangements that simplified the work.
Specifically, all network related objects are consolidated in the
neutron.objects.network module, instead of being scattered through the
code base. Also, some setup code from test_policy relevant to RBAC was
moved into the base test class so that it can be utilized by other RBAC
enabled objects, like network.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5160d0ab9e8042c356229420739db0ce42842368

Some of tests use different method of

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: Ib8dec9d44ce66b1b7ff1486a234fae73d29f23ff

commit_message:
Break cycle between Resource and Attributes

Attributes hold a reference to Resource via the attribute resolution
method. Let's add a weakref here to break the cycle.

Change-Id: I1cd22476c7d2d9ca0a090947b8f28d8afc413fc7

commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'cinder_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping of
services, groups that install those services, and any additional
conditions around their installations. The init tasks have been updated
to run once and loop through this mapping rather than being
included multiple times and re-run against each host. This may
potentially reduce role run times.

Common variables shared by each service's template files have also been
updated to use the service namespaced variables.

Change-Id: Ifeb890cc733921a6f882e4d9cdb778e22c82e9c5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 05:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['congress/db/db_policy_rules.py'], 'message': 'Disable subtransactions in table locking transaction

disable subtransactions to prevent interrupting
DB requests from interefering with table lock. Main issue is

MySQL to complain about subtransaction not locking tables

Change-Id: Ia1031961c83e83d4b996d9eedc7261edd6a91e17
'}]
commit_message:
Disable subtransactions in table locking transaction

disable subtransactions to prevent interrupting
DB requests from interefering with table lock. Main issue is
synchronizer interrupting and using the same session, leading
MySQL to complain about subtransaction not locking tables

Change-Id: Ia1031961c83e83d4b996d9eedc7261edd6a91e17

subject: Updates the Neutron HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver references
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 20:49:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide/source/networking-config-agents.rst'], 'message': 'Updates the Neutron HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver references

All the code related to the Hyper-V Neutron Agent and its
Security Groups Driver was fully decomposed into networking-hyperv
in Mitaka.

The only thing that remained was a debtcollector move for the
HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver, in order to prevent deployments from
breaking when upgrading to Mitaka or Newton from older versions.
This will be removed in Ocata.

Change-Id: Id1f1fa31c70fb820a44b2ba9f4e697e196aeffb9
Related: Iddc14fc4c52ba1a851e79bcd4cf4f09c63b52312
'}]
commit_message:
Updates the Neutron HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver references

All the code related to the Hyper-V Neutron Agent and its
Security Groups Driver was fully decomposed into networking-hyperv
in Mitaka.

The only thing that remained was a debtcollector move for the
HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver, in order to prevent deployments from
breaking when upgrading to Mitaka or Newton from older versions.
This will be removed in Ocata.

Change-Id: Id1f1fa31c70fb820a44b2ba9f4e697e196aeffb9
Related: Iddc14fc4c52ba1a851e79bcd4cf4f09c63b52312

subject: Use dictionary for service group mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-29 06:04:37.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'templates/ceilometer-systemd-init.j2', 'tasks/ceilometer_init_common.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_init_systemd.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_init.yml', 'templates/ceilometer-systemd-tempfiles.j2', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_init_upstart.yml', 'templates/ceilometer-upstart-init.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'ceilometer_service_names' from a list to a dictionary
mapping of services, groups that install those services. This brings
the method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order
to implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: I417f366e343a7b764e3bcd9ab75efc3a233b460b
"}]
commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'ceilometer_service_names' from a list to a dictionary
mapping of services, groups that install those services. This brings
the method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order
to implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: I417f366e343a7b764e3bcd9ab75efc3a233b460b

commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'aodh_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: I729ae43faba2ebb04d8fda85c3f51b2136853ef9

commit_message:
Accept service catalog from client side

Updates the Mistral server to accept the service catalog
from the client request. This enable the server to cooperate
with Keystone Identity V2 and V3 at the same time.

Change-Id: I7ca2aace4d5095828e5053af6965b833109d338a
Closes-Bug: #1612705
Depends-On: I86fa58de00d01c89e4bbc21dbe128f1306e2a1bf
Signed-off-by: Andras Kovi <akovi@nokia.com>

commit_message:
Update ironic auth options for Keystone v3 auth

The auth parameters `admin_username`, `admin_password`,
`admin_tenant_name` and `admin_url` of the [ironic] config
option group are now deprecated and will be removed in a
future release. Using these parameters will log a warning.
Please use `username`, `password`, `project_name `and
`auth_url` instead.
Update ironic auth options for Keystone v3  API support.
The link[1] can explain.
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/conf/ironic.py#n38

Change-Id: I33f3cb1b52a8c69b7a2711b47662b02967a74265

commit_message:
Turn on debug output from IPA by default

There's no real cost to having IPA debug output on, and it helps
operators work out from a KVM what went wrong when things get
exciting. So let's just turn it on by default.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Carden <mike.carden@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2ac525570088ea4494968666213d6f583bd5ede9

subject: Add conditional around the pid clean up process
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-27 21:06:30.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': "Add conditional around the pid clean up process

The NS metadata proxy pid cleanup process hunts for and removes
PIDs executing old code by using version tags. Under certain
conditions it's possible for an old PID to have expired before
the cleanup action has run. This change simply wraps the
`pkill` command with a test to ensure the task isn't failing.
Should a PID actually be cleaned up the task will print to stdout
and log using the logger command.

Closes-Bug: #1627185
Change-Id: I8c012feb399f8ca65172e9404b859c8f6111de35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add conditional around the pid clean up process

The NS metadata proxy pid cleanup process hunts for and removes
PIDs executing old code by using version tags. Under certain
conditions it's possible for an old PID to have expired before
the cleanup action has run. This change simply wraps the
`pkill` command with a test to ensure the task isn't failing.
Should a PID actually be cleaned up the task will print to stdout
and log using the logger command.

Closes-Bug: #1627185
Change-Id: I8c012feb399f8ca65172e9404b859c8f6111de35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp and tearDown

setUp and tearDown will be automatically called around each
testcase, so this is to remove setUp and tearDown that doing
nothing additional than super to keep code clean.

Change-Id: I8b6943602419d3f360991721d90b61888b55ea60

subject: Test address setting code paths
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-27 14:07:37.000000000', 'files': ['tests/host_vars/swift-storage4.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'tests/host_vars/swift-storage3.yml', 'tests/host_vars/swift-storage1.yml'], 'message': 'Test address setting code paths

We can set the storage and replication addresses differently for each of
the 3 swift-hosts.

swift-storage1 will use the "swift_storage_address" and
"swift_replication_address" values to set it's service and ring IPs.

swift-storage2 will use the default IPs calculated by finding the IP on
the appropriate interfaces (eth2 for storage and eth3 for replication).

swift-storage3 will use the swift_vars.storage_ip and swift_vars.repl_ip
vars to set it's service and ring IPs

This PR makes the gate more efficient by removing swift-storage4.

Depends-On: Iac72c99fc728fad82da65ae6c68a304e3d130bc1
Change-Id: I8f7eb551072a6cd6ad50c2a99c4dfc6652374efe
'}]
commit_message:
Test address setting code paths

We can set the storage and replication addresses differently for each of
the 3 swift-hosts.

swift-storage1 will use the "swift_storage_address" and
"swift_replication_address" values to set it's service and ring IPs.

swift-storage2 will use the default IPs calculated by finding the IP on
the appropriate interfaces (eth2 for storage and eth3 for replication).

swift-storage3 will use the swift_vars.storage_ip and swift_vars.repl_ip
vars to set it's service and ring IPs

This PR makes the gate more efficient by removing swift-storage4.

Depends-On: Iac72c99fc728fad82da65ae6c68a304e3d130bc1
Change-Id: I8f7eb551072a6cd6ad50c2a99c4dfc6652374efe

subject: Fixed db port when altering db for setup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 08:48:08.000000000', 'files': ['pkgos_func'], 'message': 'Fixed db port when altering db for setup

When installing a new DB, pkgos does:
ALTER DATABASE \`${dbc_dbname}\` CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci

The db port for doing this had a ":" (column) prefix. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Icb91429b9017bb0d0055b019b66f6ada0fb119ce
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed db port when altering db for setup

When installing a new DB, pkgos does:
ALTER DATABASE \`${dbc_dbname}\` CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci

The db port for doing this had a ":" (column) prefix. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: Icb91429b9017bb0d0055b019b66f6ada0fb119ce

commit_message:
Use centralised test scripts

This patch consumes the test scripts implemented by
https://review.openstack.org/375061 to ensure that
the tests and test preparation is consistent and
more maintainable.
